findings.test_name: Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
findings.issue_text: Content Security Policy (CSP) is an added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate certain types of attacks, including Cross Site Scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks. These attacks are used for everything from data theft to site defacement or distribution of malware. CSP provides a set of standard HTTP headers that allow website owners to declare approved sources of content that browsers should be allowed to load on that page — covered types are JavaScript, CSS, HTML frames, fonts, images and embeddable objects such as Java applets, ActiveX, audio and video files.
findings.alert: Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
findings.name: Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
findings.desc: Content Security Policy (CSP) is an added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate certain types of attacks, including Cross Site Scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks. These attacks are used for everything from data theft to site defacement or distribution of malware. CSP provides a set of standard HTTP headers that allow website owners to declare approved sources of content that browsers should be allowed to load on that page — covered types are JavaScript, CSS, HTML frames, fonts, images and embeddable objects such as Java applets, ActiveX, audio and video files.
findings.request_header:
GET https://platform.staging.jit.io HTTP/1.1
Host: platform.staging.jit.io
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:100.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/100.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
findings.response_header:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: text/html
Content-Length: 818
Connection: keep-alive
Last-Modified: Thu, 29 Sep 2022 12:54:26 GMT
Server: AmazonS3
Date: Thu, 29 Sep 2022 13:33:05 GMT
ETag: "b60001ff96bba56dcfbdfe1ecdfee141"
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Cache: RefreshHit from cloudfront
Via: 1.1 a0dfc1e576cc19daa2f4d5ec699792f4.cloudfront.net (CloudFront)
X-Amz-Cf-Pop: TLV50-C1
X-Amz-Cf-Id: FrxBLcaF9oiZ_5WF57gdl-pMXh2sYl9R37LtngW3_QCSIXhemLN2Vg==
findings.solution: Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to set the Content-Security-Policy header, to achieve optimal browser support: "Content-Security-Policy" for Chrome 25+, Firefox 23+ and Safari 7+, "X-Content-Security-Policy" for Firefox 4.0+ and Internet Explorer 10+, and "X-WebKit-CSP" for Chrome 14+ and Safari 6+.
